intro: Zeltnera wigginsii, commonly known as Wiggins' zeltnera, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and nutrient-poor conditions. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
